content.description: Short, steep, and pumpy!  This climb starts on good crimpers and incuts past the first 2 bolts to a lunge into a left-facing flake system.  Easier climbing deposits you at the crux: a lunge to the top lip from 2 crimps!  Worth doing.
content.location: Tennessee Tuxedo is located on Kaos Wall.  Hike up to and along Storm Jumper Wall.  60 yards beyond Storm Jumper Wall is the steep Kaos Wall.  Kaos Wall is a steep crag that currently hosts 3 climbs.

content.description: This consists of 2 boulder problems (the 2nd easier than the 1st and more obvious) separated by a stance, then there is a bit more pumpy climbing to the top. The crux come after clipping the 1st bolt. If you are tall, a long toss to the left might suffice, otherwise you are rewarded with fun body tension to lock-off moves (watch for potential footholds before cranking). It is a short route but fun stuff.
content.protection: 4 bolts & anchor (look very closely as the camo'ed bolts blend into the rock very well).
content.location: This is the middle of 3 bolted routes on the overhung Kaos Wall uphill from Storm Jumper Wall (hike along the wall to the next formation parallel to the road).

content.description: Start on overhanging rock with some big pulls to a ledge. Climb up and around the arete through some technical moves to the slab. The anchors are about 15 feet up the slab.
content.protection: 5 bolts and shuts. A small cam can be useful to reduce the runout to the 5th bolt.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on Kaos Wall and is the first route you get to as you approach from Storm Jumper Wall.
